thread.title: Philadelphia Folk Festival performers include Arlo Guthrie, Lyle Lovett, more
thread.title_full: Philadelphia Folk Festival performers include Arlo Guthrie, Lyle Lovett, more - The Morning Call

author: mcall.com
title: Philadelphia Folk Festival performers include Arlo Guthrie, Lyle Lovett, more
text:
You can hear all the sounds of American music this weekend at the 54th annual Philadelphia Folk Festival — including country, acoustic folk, funk and zydeco.
More than 120 performers will take eight stages at the 80-acre Old Pool Farm in Schwenksville in the longest continuously running folk festival in America. Highlighting the list is the legendary Arlo Guthrie, celebrating the 50th anniversary of the release of "Alice's Restaurant," the famous 18-minute musical monologue from his debut album.
c Comments Got something to say? Start the conversation and be the first to comment. Add a comment 0 Making his debut at the fest is Grammy winner Lyle Lovett and his Large Band. Other acts include Bill Cockburn, Tom Paxton, the North Mississippi Allstars and Shakey Graves.
The fest actually starts Thursday night for campers, with three bands. It continues through Sunday.
Food for sale ranges from Mexican and Greek to BBQ and vegetarian and vegan options. Artisans will sell art, musical instruments and more. There are crafts and entertainment for kids.
All festival tickets are $165; $82.50, ages 12-17; free, 11 and under (tent and vehicle camping additional cost). Daily tickets: Friday: $55; $27.50, ages 12-17; Saturday: $75; $37.50, ages 12-17; Sunday: $65; $32.50; ages 12-17. Info: pfs.org/folk-festival.
—William Gordon
